21 years ago, we stood together with Black leaders like the late Rev. Arthur Hilson, Representatives Lionel Johnson and Jackie Weatherspoon, and so many others who made MLK Jr. Day a NH holiday.

And I feel the same today. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZ6wH-VXkAAGSLE.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZ6wFdlWkAoLjfb.jpg
We can build a stronger America that works for everyone, but we have to work together to make that happen.

And today, that fight is clear as ever. I stand with everyone in New Hampshire outraged over the senseless murders of unarmed Black men and women. We must fight the rampant inequality we continue to see in our society.

MLK dedicated his life to creating a better world, and he made an enormous difference. But his efforts also stirred hate, exposing racism and some of the deepest problems affecting our nation, and he was killed in the pursuit of justice.

To honor him, we must continue his fight.
